content:
• Tuesday, March 5, 2013
  • AOBC

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 beats across the board as demand for guns continues to...

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 beats across the board as demand for guns continues to soar. Net profit more than tripled on a 39% surge in sales. The company says its plant has operated at full capacity for the last four quarters, yet still, the gun maker couldn't meet demand across all its firearm product lines. For the current quarter, it expects to earn $0.38 to $0.40 a share on sales of $165M to $170M, above analysts estimates of $0.30 on revenue of $155M, and also raised its FY outlook to $1.17 to $1.19 on sales of $575M to $580M. Despite the solid quarter, investors are taking some profit, as the stock is -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM | 19 Comments
  • SSKN

    More on Mela Sciences (MELA): Q4 comes in line with estimates. Net loss for quarter was $6.1M,...

    More on Mela Sciences (MELA): Q4 comes in line with estimates. Net loss for quarter was $6.1M, or $0.19 per diluted share, compared to a net loss of $4.5M, or $0.17 per diluted share for Q411. The higher net losses can be attributed to greater SG&A costs, and an increase in direct costs associated with the placement of MelaFind systems in dermatologists' offices. Total revenues were boosted by increased installation of its MelaFind, with 20 additional user agreements signed in Q4. Shares +4.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM
  • HCI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: HCI +11%. ELX +10%. HNR +8%. PAY +5%. BPZ +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: HCI +11%. ELX +10%. HNR +8%. PAY +5%. BPZ +4%.
    After-hours top losers: AVAV -22%. HLS -11%. NAVB -7%. JMBA -6%. OTCPK:IMUC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +10.7% AH in reaction to reports of Hugo Chavez's death....

    Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) +10.7% AH in reaction to reports of Hugo Chavez's death. HNR recently had 77% of its assets in Venezuela, which doesn't look likely to change soon after Indonesia's Pertamina recently scrapped its plan to buy HNR's Venezuelan assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) resumes trading following a halt, and is now down 26.2% AH following...

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) resumes trading following a halt, and is now down 26.2% AH following its big FQ3 miss. The company blames delays in government purchases for UAVs, while insisting it hasn't lost orders. FY13 guidance is for revenue of $230M-$250M and EPS of $0.30-$0.50, far below prior guidance of $348M-$370M and $1.41-$1.51, and a consensus of $353.2M and $1.45. Backlog stood at $70.5M at quarter's end, -22% Q/Q. FQ3 product revenue -36% Y/Y, services -33%. SG&A expenses -19%, R&D +43%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • STXS

    More on Stereotaxis (NASDAQ:STXS): Q4 EPS misses by a penny, but revenue comes in line with...

    More on Stereotaxis (NASDAQ:STXS): Q4 EPS misses by a penny, but revenue comes in line with estimates. EPS were Up 45% Y/Y, with sales up 5% over the same period. Separately, the company says Michael Kaminski will step down as President and CEO, effective April 12. It names Chairman William Mills III as interim CEO and created an interim Office of the Chief Executive, with Director Dr. Euan Thomson providing support and guidance in certain areas. Shares +12.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • SYX

    Systemax (NYSE:SYX): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $935.2M (-4.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Systemax (NYSE:SYX): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $935.2M (-4.4% Y/Y) misses by $75M. Shares -6.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (NYSE:MTG) commences its capital raise with a secondary offering of 135M shares...

    MGIC Investment (NYSE:MTG) commences its capital raise with a secondary offering of 135M shares and $350M of convertible notes due in 2020. The current stock float is 202M shares. Shares -7.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO): Q4 EPS of -$0.34 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $1.9M misses by $2.1M. Shares...

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO): Q4 EPS of -$0.34 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $1.9M misses by $2.1M. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $136.2M (+38.8% Y/Y)...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $136.2M (+38.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.52M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • CYOU

    Sohu (SOHU +11.6%) and subsidiary Changyou (CYOU +11.2%) soar in the final hour of trading on a...

    Sohu (SOHU +11.6%) and subsidiary Changyou (CYOU +11.2%) soar in the final hour of trading on a report Sohu is planning to delist from the NASDAQ and go private. Citron Research, long a fan of Sohu, thinks the company should sell for at least $65/share - Sohu closed today at $48.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +3.2%) is set to close in the green today after the company provided...

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +3.2%) is set to close in the green today after the company provided a positive update on Phase 2 clinical trials for NX-1207, a drug being tested for early-stage prostate cancer. The trial has reached the halfway point in patient recruitment and safety assessments to date have shown no serious or unexpected adverse effects. The drug is also in Phase 3 clinical trials for treating benign prostatic hyperplasia and has been tested in 10 trials to date, of which 6 are ongoing or nearing completion.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • ENSG

    The Ensign Group (ENSG +3%) moves up today after acquiring Legacy Rehabilitation and Living, a...

    The Ensign Group (ENSG +3%) moves up today after acquiring Legacy Rehabilitation and Living, a 150-bed skilled nursing facility in Amarillo, Texas. The company expects the newly-acquired facility, which had an occupancy rate of 50% at acquisition, to be accretive to earnings in FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • JCP

    Though it's been hotly debated in retail circles for quite a while, it looks like directors at...

    Though it's been hotly debated in retail circles for quite a while, it looks like directors at J.C. Penney (JCP -9.5%) are finally considering a change at the top. If sales don't turn around, a push to sell the company or replace Ron Johnson could be in the offing, according to The Wall Street Journal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 21 Comments
  • ZOLT

    Zoltek (ZOLT +16%) gains big today on the back of the after hours disclosure by Quinpario...

    Zoltek (ZOLT +16%) gains big today on the back of the after hours disclosure by Quinpario Partners that it holds a 10.13% stake in the company, making it the largest shareholder. Quinpario also delivered a letter to ZOLT requesting a special meeting of shareholders to remove and replace all existing board members.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • DYAX

    Shares of Dyax (DYAX +14.4%) pop today after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy rating...

    Shares of Dyax (DYAX +14.4%) pop today after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy rating and a $6 price target. Jefferies notes that with DYAX's wholly owned marketed orphan drug asset plus a widely partnered tech platform, the stocks makes an attractive small-cap biotech play. Additionally, long-term U.S. Kalbitor sales grow steadily, while royalties from potential Japan Kalbitor sales and U.S. ramucirumab sales across an increasing number of cancer indications provide additional growth catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • REGI

    Piper Jaffray keeps Renewable Energy (REGI -16.3%) at Overweight after Q4 results show what it...

    Piper Jaffray keeps Renewable Energy (REGI -16.3%) at Overweight after Q4 results show what it sees as improving supply and demand in the biodiesel market. The firm believes REGI will continue to improve its margin profile bringing on flexible feedstock technology at new facilities. But investors apparently can't get past the 13% Y/Y drop in Q4 revenues to $232M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 9 Comments
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +5.4%) moves up today with a solid Q4 earnings beat on narrower...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +5.4%) moves up today with a solid Q4 earnings beat on narrower losses. Piper Jaffray notes that the company's key drug fostamatinib's Phase 3 studies look encouraging, and will provide an upside to stock performance over the near term. JP Morgan agrees, saying that rheumatoid arthritis represents a huge and growing worldwide annual market of nearly $13B, and fostamatinib could emerge as a meaningful player in this space.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +4.7%) makes new 52-week highs ahead today's Q4 report; shares are now up 14% since...

    Qihoo (QIHU +4.7%) makes new 52-week highs ahead today's Q4 report; shares are now up 14% since last Tuesday's close. In addition to T.H. Capital, Maxim Group has been singing the company's praises: last week, the firm argued strong Q4 traffic and sales volume for Chinese e-commerce sites (they make up ~50% of Qihoo's ad sales) bodes well. Shares now trade at 32x 2013E EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +10.2%) gains today after Jefferies initiates coverage with a...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +10.2%) gains today after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $2 price target. Jefferies says that despite positive trial results for its lupus treatment, the stock trades at a discount to EV, and key interim catalysts over the next 12 - 18 months may turn out to be value drivers for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUS

    Deutsche Bank says recent attacks on Nu Skin (NUS -2.8%) are "unfounded and misguided," and...

    Deutsche Bank says recent attacks on Nu Skin (NUS -2.8%) are "unfounded and misguided," and reiterates its Buy rating with a price target of $60. Deutsche calls the company one of the few growth names in its coverage that successfully overcomes difficult comparisons with better than expected results, and is likely to deliver high single to low double-digit growth again in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +12%) ramps higher after saying it's received the go ahead from the...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +12%) ramps higher after saying it's received the go ahead from the FDA to proceed with Phase 1 clinical trials of GR-MD-02, a treatment for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease with advanced fibrosis. The study will be conducted in up to seven centers in the U.S., with enrollment and infusion of the first cohort to begin in May, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • SHLDQ

    A tale of two retailers: Analysts can't help but note the different directions Sears Holdings...

    A tale of two retailers: Analysts can't help but note the different directions Sears Holdings (SHLD +6.7%) and J.C. Penney (JCP -9.8%) trade in today as one retailer sees an insider buy and the other hears word that a REIT is selling. On the real estate front the divergence of results is clear: Sears Holdings is considered well-positioned and ahead of the curve while Maxim has a warning out that J.C. Penney's real estate might not be able to fetch enough to even pay off the company's long-term debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 8 Comments
  • STP

    A solar trade war between the EU and China looks inevitable. EU customs officials will start...

    A solar trade war between the EU and China looks inevitable. EU customs officials will start registering Chinese module imports tomorrow, a move that could pave the way for tariffs. The EC has until June 6 to impose provisional tariffs; EU member states have until Dec. 5 to vote on definitive tariffs. The Chinese government appears on its way to imposing tariffs on polysilicon imports from the EU, U.S., and South Korea. Suntech (STP -4.3%) is lower, but other Chinese solar names are following the market higher. YGE +5.8%. JKS +6.6%. TSL +5.6%. SOL +5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -4.8%) makes fresh post-IPO lows after Needham launches coverage with a...

    Millennial Media (MM -4.8%) makes fresh post-IPO lows after Needham launches coverage with a Hold. While expecting Millennial to "continue to experience exceptionally strong growth over the next few years," the firm sees "emerging competition" limiting upside to current estimates. The report comes as one of those emerging rivals, Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), rolls out a mobile ad API for Android apps offered in its Appstore. Amazon is already selling Kindle lock screen ads, and has reportedly considered making a mobile ad acquisition.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • ACUR

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:ACUR +59%. HIMX +37%. MTG +25%. CREE +15%. APP +15%. ZOLT +15%. ASNA...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:ACUR +59%. HIMX +37%. MTG +25%. CREE +15%. APP +15%. ZOLT +15%. ASNA +14%. SNTS +14%. PKOH +14%. DYAX +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: IPXL -25%. RNIN -23%. DRWI -19%. REGI -17%. OTCPK:TELOZ -17%. SHIP -14%. CSUN -10%. SDT -10%. JCP -10%. OTC:PSTR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • PFE

    The USPTO has reissued Pfizer's (PFE +1.5%) Celebrex patent, granting it exclusivity to December...

    The USPTO has reissued Pfizer's (PFE +1.5%) Celebrex patent, granting it exclusivity to December 2015. The decision gives the drug giant U.S. exclusivity - and a monopoly sales - for an additional 18 months. The reissued patent covers methods of treating osteoarthritis and other approved conditions with celecoxib, the active ingredient in Celebrex, whose prior patent was previously invalidated by a federal appeals court in 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead (GILD +2.3%) reports the results from its Phase 2 study of its HIV regimen Tenofovir...

    Gilead (GILD +2.3%) reports the results from its Phase 2 study of its HIV regimen Tenofovir Alafenamide, saying achieved comparable viral suppression to Stribild while demonstrating improvement in renal and bone safety indicators. Phase 3 studies are now underway, with initial results expected in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon (VZ +0.9%) is bent on taking full control of Verizon Wireless this year, and has even...

    Verizon (VZ +0.9%) is bent on taking full control of Verizon Wireless this year, and has even discussed merging with Vodafone (VOD +3.9%) to achieve this goal, Bloomberg reports. Merger talks are said to have stalled over "disagreements on leadership and headquarters location," thus making a buyout or partial sale of Vodafone's 45% stake (estimated to be worth $115B) more likely. One source claims Vodafone is open to using the proceeds to make European acquisitions. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 10 Comments
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold (SA +5.8%) says it completed the filing process of its environmental assessment...

    Seabridge Gold (SA +5.8%) says it completed the filing process of its environmental assessment statements for its KSM gold-copper-silver project with the British Columbia and Canadian governments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • SDT

    SandRidge Mississippian Trust I (SDT -9.5%) is cut to Sell from Hold with a reduced $13 target...

    SandRidge Mississippian Trust I (SDT -9.5%) is cut to Sell from Hold with a reduced $13 target price at Wunderlich, citing a weakening distribution outlook due to higher costs, lower production and a higher mix of natural gas being produced. Investors may be attracted to SDT's yield, but the firm says investors should focus on the trust's risk profile. SDR -4.9%, PER -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 33 Comments
  • PKOH

    ParkOhio (PKOH +12%) moves up after reporting Q4 net income of $7.7M, or $0.63 per diluted...

    ParkOhio (PKOH +12%) moves up after reporting Q4 net income of $7.7M, or $0.63 per diluted share, beating the $0.50 per share Street consensus. Net sales were $275.7M, an increase of $41.1M, or 18%, from net sales of $234.6M for Q411. Analysts had expected $276.8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SSNLF

    PC DRAM prices continue to surge in the face of weak OEM demand: Digitimes reports spot prices...

    PC DRAM prices continue to surge in the face of weak OEM demand: Digitimes reports spot prices recently rose another 5% thanks to ongoing production shifts to mobile/server DRAM. Industry consolidation - Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), Micron (MU +3.5%), and SK Hynix are seen controlling 90% of the 2013 market - probably isn't hurting either. MKM's Daniel Berenbaum is out with a bullish note on Micron: he's pleased with improving DRAM and NAND pricing, and notes shares trade only 15% above book value. He's a little worried about NAND execution, and Micron's higher debt load post-Elpida. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • LM

    Legg Mason (LM +3.1%) pops as CFO Pete Nachtwey tells the Citi Financial Services Conference...

    Legg Mason (LM +3.1%) pops as CFO Pete Nachtwey tells the Citi Financial Services Conference (presentation) the company could trim the number of funds it offers and its 32 offices. He cautions, however, not to expect a repeat of the major cuts made over the last few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CWST

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST -12.6%) trades lower despite beating on its FQ3 late yesterday. Net...

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST -12.6%) trades lower despite beating on its FQ3 late yesterday. Net losses narrowed as charges related to an investment weighed on the waste- management company's year-ago results, but revenue was still relatively flat in the latest period. The company also lowered FY guidance, now expecting revenue of $462M to $472M, versus previous projections for revenue of $468M to $478M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • FOE

    Ferro (FOE -2.8%) says it will redeploy, divest or curtail assets that can't generate sufficient...

    Ferro (FOE -2.8%) says it will redeploy, divest or curtail assets that can't generate sufficient returns, and is reviewing its product lines to determine potential to create value and generate cash, a day after it rejected A. Schulman's (SHLM +1.2%) $563M buyout offer. Much of FOE's 8% drop in Q4 revenues is traced to weakness in its electronic materials business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI -17.3%) is crashing for the second day in a row after announcing a big FQ4...

    DragonWave (DRWI -17.3%) is crashing for the second day in a row after announcing a big FQ4 warning. Shares are now down 40% from Friday's close, and the company sports a market cap of just $55M. With huge losses forecast even prior to the warning, the Street appears to be questioning the company's ability to survive. DragonWave had $36.4M in cash/equivalents as of Nov. 30, and $15M in debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.7%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $27 price target cut...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.7%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $27 price target cut from $50 at BMO, a day after shares slid 5.8%. The firm cites CLF's equity raise, which has strengthened the balance sheet but effectively forces shareholders to pay for poor performance. BMO also sees no near-term improvement to costs at Bloom Lake and points to higher 2013 capex.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax (HIMX +26.2%) takes off after SA contributor Mark Gomes says his firm believes the...

    Himax (HIMX +26.2%) takes off after SA contributor Mark Gomes says his firm believes the chipmaker will be the main supplier of microdisplays for Google Glass. Comments from management about shipments for a head-mounted display, and the fact an image provided by The Verge of a Glass prototype is a perfect match for a Himax-powered display shown off at a trade show, are cited as proof. Glass headsets are set to arrive by year's end at a sub-$1,500 price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNTS

    Santarus (SNTS +13.2%) continues to rally this morning on the back of a blowout Q4. Net earnings...

    Santarus (SNTS +13.2%) continues to rally this morning on the back of a blowout Q4. Net earnings nearly tripled as the specialty-biopharmaceutical company reported double-digit revenue growth and gave upbeat earnings guidance for FY13, now expecting to earn $320M to $325M in revenues and net income of $50M to $54M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • TEF

    Debt-laden Telefonica (TEF +2%) obtains a $1B credit facility to buy infrastructure gear from...

    Debt-laden Telefonica (TEF +2%) obtains a $1B credit facility to buy infrastructure gear from Ericsson (ERIC +2.9%). The news follows recent deals to use Ericsson's equipment in 4G buildouts in the U.K., Brazil, and Chile. Compared with U.S. carriers, Telefonica has been taking its time to deploy 4G. Ericsson recently boasted of having a 50%+ 4G LTE volume share (likely to come down, but still impressive), and of scoring LTE deals with 9 of the world's 10 largest mobile carriers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • MJNA

    Shares of Medical Marijuana Inc. (OTCPK:MJNA -3.9%) slip today after a Seeking Alpha article...

    Shares of Medical Marijuana Inc. (OTCPK:MJNA -3.9%) slip today after a Seeking Alpha article calls a number of transactions (including the company's asset and inventory sale of PhytoSPHERE) as well as recent guidance into question.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 9 Comments
  • FSM

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +4.2%) says combined inferred resources for its Caylloma mine in Peru...

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +4.2%) says combined inferred resources for its Caylloma mine in Peru and San Jose mine in Mexico rose to 10.9M tons containing an estimated 46.8M oz. silver and 273K oz. gold, reflecting Y/Y increases of 38% in contained silver oz. and 26% in contained gold oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • A

    Credit Suisse gives Agilent (A +2.5%) a vote of confidence, launching coverage on the...

    Credit Suisse gives Agilent (A +2.5%) a vote of confidence, launching coverage on the test/measurement equipment giant with an Outperform and $48 PT. Agilent's recent FQ1 miss and guidance cut provides "a more attractive entry point for long-term investors," CS argues, while adding a proprietary survey indicates "continued traction in life sciences and chemical analysis."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ABIO

    ARCA Biopharma (ABIO +6.7%) trades up after announcing a 6-for-1 reverse split of its common...

    ARCA Biopharma (ABIO +6.7%) trades up after announcing a 6-for-1 reverse split of its common stock, which became effective after the close yesterday, and trading on the NASDAQ on a split adjusted basis as of today. The reverse split reduces ABIO's number of shares issued and outstanding from approximately 19.1M shares to approximately 3.2M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • GOOG

    The Google Express (GOOG +1.8%) refuses to slow down: shares are outperforming/making new highs...

    The Google Express (GOOG +1.8%) refuses to slow down: shares are outperforming/making new highs again today as Jefferies becomes the latest firm to slap a $1,000 PT on the search giant. The firm cites some of the usual reasons: YouTube, improving mobile ad prices, and e-commerce initiatives. (Bernstein) (CLSA)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • APC

    Anadarko (APC +3.2%) says it will sell a 12.75% interest in the Heidelberg deepwater oil project...

    Anadarko (APC +3.2%) says it will sell a 12.75% interest in the Heidelberg deepwater oil project in the Gulf of Mexico to an undisclosed party for $860M to ensure funding until production starts in 2016. APC will continue to operate the project with a 31.5% interest; XOM, APA, E and STO own the remaining stake in the field, estimated to hold up to 400M barrels of recoverable resources.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS +3.5%) catches an upgrade to Buy from Needham: the firm is pleased with the 3D...

    Stratasys (SSYS +3.5%) catches an upgrade to Buy from Needham: the firm is pleased with the 3D printer maker's Monday Q4 beat and foresees growing operating leverage. Stratasys, which guided for 2013 revenue of $430M-$445M and EPS of $1.80-$1.95 (largely favorable to a consensus of $421.1M and $1.86), is now up 11% since its Q4 report was issued. 13.8% of the float was shorted as of Feb. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • MSTR

    An upgrade to Outperform from FBR sends MicroStrategy (MSTR +6.6%) shooting higher. The firm...

    An upgrade to Outperform from FBR sends MicroStrategy (MSTR +6.6%) shooting higher. The firm expects recent sales personnel changes and margin expansion to provide a lift, and notes shares only trade at 1.4x EV/sales, well below the 3.2x sported by its peer group (ed: shares do, however, trade at a steep 26x 2014E EPS).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • M

    Martha Stewart is reported to be on the stand in the case involving Macy's (M +1.4%), J.C....

    Martha Stewart is reported to be on the stand in the case involving Macy's (M +1.4%), J.C. Penney (JCP -6.3%), and Marth Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +0.4%). Though some analysts think shares of JCP might swing wildly one way or the other after a verdict is announced in the trial, others think that in the long run all three retailers are tarnished by the airing of dirty laundry and accusations of double-dealing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • EVEP-OLD

    EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD +2.3%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Credit...

    EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD +2.3%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Credit Suisse, which expects completion of the Utica monetization and reinvestment in 2013 to result in meaningful accretion to unitholders. EVEP's high-multiple growth platform should drive sustainable, differentiated cash flow growth over the near-term and long-term, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • NAV

    A faster pace of truck orders in February than forecast by analysts is enough to light a small...

    A faster pace of truck orders in February than forecast by analysts is enough to light a small torch under some trucking-related stocks: Advancers: Navistar (NAV +4.4%), Oshkosh (OSK +3.4%), and Paccar (PCAR +1.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +11.4%) raises its FQ3 guidance: the company now expects revenue of $335M-$350M and...

    Cree (CREE +11.4%) raises its FQ3 guidance: the company now expects revenue of $335M-$350M and EPS of $0.31-$0.36 vs. prior guidance of $325M-$345M and $0.30-$0.35, and a consensus of $336.1M and $0.33.     Retail winners today include Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) and American Apparel (APP), both...

    Retail winners today include Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) and American Apparel (APP), both up double-digits after reporting solid earnings. Both companies blasted past the estimates of analysts as sales were boosted by a strong online business. It continues a trend of smaller retail chains chipping away at department stores online, highlighted dramatically by J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) online meltdown (-34.4% Q4, -37% Q3) and to a much lesser extent by growth rates at Dillard's (NYSE:DDS), Kohl's (NYSE:KSS), Sears (SHLD), Saks (NYSE:SKS), and Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN).
